document.title: Setting Colors in CSS
document.overview: Colors are an essential element of design and development. Here’s the first part of an in-depth series on how to work with colors in CSS.

body.raw:
# Defining Colors in CSS: A Deep Dive

We define colors as a numeric or textual representation of the human visual perception of light — or, a physical object illuminated with it. We can quantify and physically describe human color perception through [_Colorimetry_](https://www.britannica.com/science/colorimetry) — the science of color measurement. It allows us to represent colors in numerical terms and to measure color differences between specimens. If two objects have different [_spectra_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectrum) but produce the same physical sensation, we say they have the same color.
body.html:
Defining Colors in CSS: A Deep Dive

We define colors as a numeric or textual representation of the human visual perception of light — or, a physical object illuminated with it. We can quantify and physically describe human color perception through Colorimetry — the science of color measurement. It allows us to represent colors in numerical terms and to measure color differences between specimens. If two objects have different spectra but produce the same physical sensation, we say they have the same color.

document.title: What’s New in ES2021
document.overview: In this article, we’ll take an introductory look at the most interesting features that ES2021 (or ES12) provides to us.

body.raw:
# Defining Colors in CSS: A Deep Dive

ES2021 (or ES12) is the ECMAScript version corresponding to the year 2021. This version doesn’t introduce as many new features as those that appeared in ES6, back in 2015. Nonetheless, some valuable features have been included.
body.html:
Defining Colors in CSS: A Deep Dive

ES2021 (or ES12) is the ECMAScript version corresponding to the year 2021. This version doesn’t introduce as many new features as those that appeared in ES6, back in 2015. Nonetheless, some valuable features have been included.
